title: The Plucky Squire Gets New Update
text: Key Takeaways - Update 1.4.0 for The Plucky Squire on Switch fixes bugs in multiple chapters, including a box puzzle correction in Chapter 9. - Chapter 6 had the most fixes, preventing crashes, moving objects to avoid inaccessible areas, and fixing NPC behavior. - More updates to The Plucky Squire for other platforms are currently in the works. The Plucky Squire received a new update for Nintendo Switch players that fixes a long list of various bugs throughout the game. Nearly every chapter in The Plucky Squire has received some sort of fix, and updates for other platforms and future patches to the game are currently in the works. The Plucky Squire is an action adventure puzzle game developed by All Possible Futures and published by Devolver Digital. The Plucky Squire features a multimedia art style that mixes 2D characters with a 3D world to create a unique aesthetic fueled by an interesting story. Players follow Jot and his friends as they discover a three-dimensional world outside their storybook and must solve a variety of puzzles and mini-challenges. The Plucky Squire has been out for just over a month now, and is receiving another update for Switch gamers. [Related ](/plucky-squire-performance-ps-plus-good-game-awards/) [ Why The Plucky Squire's Performance May Mean Good Things Are About to Come ](/plucky-squire-performance-ps-plus-good-game-awards/) The Plucky Squire is out now, and with the fact that it's All Possible Future's debut title, the game and studio have quite a running start for them. As shared on All Possible Future's Twitter page, update 1.4.0 is now out for players on Nintendo Switch. The update cleans up a lot of minor bugs throughout the various chapters within the game. Most notably, the box puzzle in Chapter 9 of The Plucky Squire received an adjustment that fixed boxes colliding with each other and getting stuck. Alongside that, a variety of general fixes were added to the game to adjust collisions with lightbulbs, text overlapping, and the way mini-game inputs were displayed. Some additional updates for the game came to several chapters. Chapter 2 received some adjustments to portal collisions and character combining. The word puzzle in Chapter 4 of The Plucky Squire also received an update that fixed words getting stuck behind a frog, alongside issues with the bridge scaling up and some text being unreadable. Chapter 7 also got a few adjustments added that fixed some NPC behavior and an unintended puzzle solution. Chapter 6 of The Plucky Squire received the biggest update out of all the chapters. Fixes were made that prevent the game from potentially crashing during a mini-game. Alongside this, several objects such as crates and words received updates to prevent them from reaching inaccessible locations. Finally, issues such as Zip not following Jot properly, players getting stuck in certain areas, and mini-game objectives not being shown have also been fixed. These updates are currently live on the Nintendo Switch version of The Plucky Squire. While future patches and updates to the game on other platforms are not live yet, the developers stated that those changes are currently in the works. The Plucky Squire Switch Version 1.4.0 Patch Notes Chapter 2 - Fixed characters not combining properly in some platforming sections - Fixed the possibility of jumping into a portal incorrectly without a block Chapter 4 - Fixed getting stuck after scaling up a bridge - Fixed the text on a card being unreadable when approaching it - Fixed word getting stuck behind a frog Chapter 5 - Fixes some collision issues leading to dialogue box errors - Fixed issue of getting stuck between a specific object - Fixed textures not appearing properly when entering the city Chapter 6 - Fixed a crash that could occur after some time in a minigame - Fixed a crate moving to inaccessible locations if placed on a minecart - Fixed a word being able to be thrown in an inaccessible location - Fixed getting stuck after brute forcing through a scary obstacle - Fixed necessary items that could become lost - Fixed Zip not following Jot in some 2D sections - Fixed objectives not appearing properly in minigame after several attempts - Fixed words getting stuck in a specific page and transition areas Chapter 7 - Fixed a gem potentially disappearing after being taken to another page - Fixed NPCs running away at the beginning of a cutscene - Fixed breaking block using the sword instead of the intended solution Chapter 9 - Fixed boxes colliding with each other and getting stuck General - Fixed text in Japanese overlapping with an image in the main menu - Fixed issue when leaving a page quickly after exiting the training room - Fixed all mini-games control inputs being erroneously displayed - Fixed lightbulbs colliding with objects and moving to unintended positions
